2812.highlights:
Unusual egg was captured on camera by US YouTube user Elman511 .
Shows him cracking the giant egg to reveal a normal sized one inside .
Phenomenon is caused when an oocyte - which becomes a yolk - is released too soon and merges with an earlier egg that hasn't been laid .
2812.summary:
Unusual egg was captured on camera by US YouTube user Elman511 .
  Shows him cracking the giant egg to reveal a normal sized one inside .
 Unusual egg was captured on camera by US YouTube user Elman511 .
 Unusual egg was captured on camera by US YouTube user Elman511 .
 Phenomenon is caused when an oocyte - which becomes a yolk - is released too soon and merges with an earlier egg that hasn't been laid .
2812.bart_summary: YouTube user Elman511 cracked open the over-sized egg that was laid by one of his hens, exclaiming: ‘The big egg has another normal egg in it!’ While the instance is extremely rare, it’s caused when the hen is in the process of forming an egg in her oviduct and another oocyte – the ovum or egg cell that becomes the yolk of the egg – is released too soon. In a counter-peristalsis contraction, a second oocyte is released by the ovary before the first egg has completed its journey. This results in an egg with another made inside it, producing two yolks.
